Basic checks and annotation of ADM data

adm_annotate.Rd

Performs basic checks and annotation of ADM data.

Usage

adm_annotate(x)

Arguments

x

A tidied adm data frame, as tidied by adm_rename()

Value

The supplied data frame x with additional annotations

Details

Checks that

  • all gender data are in known values (Female, Male or Unknown)

Annotates each row with

  • visit_length_days: length of stay (in days)

  • person_id_short: shortened person_id created using person_id_shorten()

See also

adt_annotate() annotates ADT data

Author

R.J.B. Goudie

Examples

adm_data_example
#> # A tibble: 5 × 13
#>   person_id visit_id visit_start_datetime visit_end_datetime  gender ethnicity death_date age_at_visit_start adm_service        ward    discharge_destination discharged_deceased readmitted_within_30…¹

#> 5 CC               5 2021-02-02 08:00:00  2021-02-02 18:00:00 Female "White\r… NA                         50 Emergency Medicine EMERGE… 0                     0                   0                     
#> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​readmitted_within_30_days
adm_annotate(adm_data_example) %>%
  relocate(visit_length_days, person_id_short)
